item.title: New York Green Taxi Data Analysis
item.description:
New York Taxi Data Analysis¶

Introduction¶

In this analysis, I will be analysing the New York Taxi Data for Green Taxi.

Data used is from Sept, 1st 2015 to Sept, 30th 2015. Green Taxi: Started in 2013, to serve outer-borough commuters. Therefore, Green Taxis are not allowed to make pickups …
item.dc:creator: Gaurav Modi

item.title: Bash Commands
item.description:
In [ ]:
```
# SOURCE https://www.datacamp.com/community/tutorials/shell-commands-data-scientist

## Number of lines in file
wc -l filename.txt

## Number of words in a file
wc -w filename.txt

## Number of files in a folder
ls -l | wc -l

## Display top 2 lines of a file
head -n 2 filename.txt …

item.title: A/B Testing of Mobile Game Cookie Cats
item.description:
1. Of cats and cookies¶

Cookie Cats is a hugely popular mobile puzzle game developed by Tactile Entertainment. It’s a classic “connect three”-style puzzle game where the player must connect tiles of the same color to clear the board and win the level. It also features singing cats …

item.title: Jupyter Notebook Settings
item.description:
Ipython Settings¶

In [ ]:
#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# ipython settings
%reload_ext autoreload
%autoreload 2
%matplotlib inline

#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
## change from scientific notation to decimal point in pandas
pd.set_option('display.float_format', lambda x: '%.0f' % x)

## Font Setting
plt.rcParams['font.sans-serif'] = ('Helvetica', 'Arial', 'Open Sans', 'Bitstream Vera Sans')

#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#Limiting floats output to 3 decimal points
pd.set_option …

item.title: Seaborn Cookbook
item.description:
Univariante Distributions Plots¶

In [ ]:
# Univariate distribution of observations with KDE
sns.distplot(spend.amount, hist=False, color="g", kde_kws={"shade": True})

# jitter tp spread the data points instead of overlap
sns.stripplot(x='cyl', y='hp', data=auto, size=3, jitter=True)

# doesn't overlap the data points
sns.swarmplot …
